enabled.description: Enabled can be used to enable attaching to a container

disableReplace.description:
DisableReplace prevents DevSpace from actually replacing the pod with modifications so that
the pod starts up correctly.

disableTTY.description: DisableTTY is used to tell DevSpace to not use a TTY connection for attaching

download.description: Download is the download limit in kilo bytes per second

upload.description: Upload is the upload limit in kilo bytes per second

BandwidthLimits.description: BandwidthLimits defines the struct for specifying the sync bandwidth limits

inCluster.description: InCluster if specified, DevSpace will use BuildKit to build the image within the cluster

preferMinikube.description: PreferMinikube if false, will not try to use the minikube docker daemon to build the image

args.description: Args are additional arguments to call docker buildx build with

command.description: Command to override the base command to create a builder and build images. Defaults to ["docker", "buildx"]

BuildKitConfig.description: BuildKitConfig tells the DevSpace CLI to

name.description:
Name is the name of the builder to use. If omitted, DevSpace will try to create
or reuse a builder in the form devspace-$NAMESPACE

namespace.description:
Namespace where to create the builder deployment in. Defaults to the current
active namespace.

rootless.description: Rootless if enabled will create a rootless builder deployment.

image.description: Image is the docker image to use for the BuildKit deployment

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is the node selector to use for the BuildKit deployment

noCreate.description:
NoCreate. By default, DevSpace will try to create a new builder if it cannot be found.
If this is true, DevSpace will fail if the specified builder cannot be found.

noRecreate.description:
NoRecreate. By default, DevSpace will try to recreate the builder if the builder configuration
in the devspace.yaml differs from the actual builder configuration. If this is
true, DevSpace will not try to do that.

noLoad.description:
NoLoad if enabled, DevSpace will not try to load the built image into the local docker
daemon if skip push is defined

createArgs.description: CreateArgs are additional args to create the builder with.

BuildKitInClusterConfig.description: BuildKitInClusterConfig holds the buildkit builder config

name.description: Name is the name of the helm chart to deploy. Can also be a local path or an oci url

version.description: Version is the version of the helm chart to deploy

repo.description: RepoURL is the url of the repo to deploy the chart from

username.description: Username is the username to authenticate to the chart repo. When using an OCI chart, used for registry auth

password.description: Password is the password to authenticate to the chart repo, When using an OCI chart, used for registry auth

path.description:
Path is the local path where DevSpace can find the artifact.
This option is mutually exclusive with the git option.

git.description:
Git is the remote repository to download the artifact from. You can either use
https projects or ssh projects here, but need to make sure git can pull the project.
This option is mutually exclusive with the path option.

subPath.description: SubPath is a path within the git repository where the artifact lies in

branch.description: Branch is the git branch to pull

tag.description: Tag is the tag to pull

revision.description: Revision is the git revision to pull

cloneArgs.description: CloneArgs are additional arguments that should be supplied to the git CLI

disableShallow.description:
DisableShallow can be used to turn off shallow clones as these are the default used
by devspace

disablePull.description: DisablePull will disable pulling every time DevSpace is reevaluating this source

ChartConfig.description: ChartConfig defines the helm chart options

name.description: Name is the name of a command that is used via `devspace run NAME`

section.description: Section can be used to group similar commands together in `devspace list commands`

command.description: Command is the command that should be executed. For example: 'echo 123'

args.description:
Args are optional and if defined, command is not executed within a shell
and rather directly.

appendArgs.description:
AppendArgs will append arguments passed to the DevSpace command automatically to
the specified command.

description.description: Description describes what the command is doing and can be seen in `devspace list commands`

internal.description: Internal commands are not show in list and are usable through run_command

after.description:
After is executed after the command was run. It is executed also when
the command was interrupted which will set the env variable COMMAND_INTERRUPT
to true as well as when the command errored which will set the error string to
COMMAND_ERROR.

command.description:
Command to execute to build the image. You can use ${runtime.images.my-image.image} and ${runtime.image.my-image.tag}
to reference the image and tag that should get built.

onChange.description: OnChange will determine when the command should be rerun

CustomConfig.description: CustomConfig tells the DevSpace CLI to build with a custom build script

name.description: Name is used internally

disabled.description: Disabled excludes this dependency from variable resolution and pipeline runs

path.description:
Path is the local path where DevSpace can find the artifact.
This option is mutually exclusive with the git option.

git.description:
Git is the remote repository to download the artifact from. You can either use
https projects or ssh projects here, but need to make sure git can pull the project.
This option is mutually exclusive with the path option.

subPath.description: SubPath is a path within the git repository where the artifact lies in

branch.description: Branch is the git branch to pull

tag.description: Tag is the tag to pull

revision.description: Revision is the git revision to pull

cloneArgs.description: CloneArgs are additional arguments that should be supplied to the git CLI

disableShallow.description:
DisableShallow can be used to turn off shallow clones as these are the default used
by devspace

disablePull.description: DisablePull will disable pulling every time DevSpace is reevaluating this source

pipeline.description: Pipeline is the pipeline to deploy by default. Defaults to 'deploy'

vars.description: Vars are variables that should be passed to the dependency

overwriteVars.description: OverwriteVars specifies if DevSpace should pass the parent variables to the dependency

ignoreDependencies.description: IgnoreDependencies defines if dependencies of the dependency should be excluded

namespace.description: Namespace specifies the namespace this dependency should be deployed to

name.description: Name of the deployment

helm.description: Helm tells DevSpace to deploy this deployment via helm

kubectl.description: Kubectl tells DevSpace to deploy this deployment via kubectl or kustomize

tanka.description: Tanka tells DevSpace to deployment via Tanka

updateImageTags.description:
UpdateImageTags lets you define if DevSpace should update the tags of the images defined in the
images section with their most recent built tag.

namespace.description: Namespace where to deploy this deployment

DeploymentConfig.description: DeploymentConfig defines the configuration how the devspace should be deployed

container.description: Container is the container name these services should get started.

arch.description:
Target Container architecture to use for the devspacehelper (currently amd64 or arm64). Defaults to amd64, but
devspace tries to find out the architecture by itself by looking at the node this container runs on.

devImage.description:
DevImage is the image to use for this container and will replace the existing image
if necessary.

command.description: Command can be used to override the entrypoint of the container

args.description: Args can be used to override the args of the container

workingDir.description: WorkingDir can be used to override the working dir of the container

env.description:
Env can be used to add environment variables to the container. DevSpace will
not replace existing environment variables if an environment variable is defined here.

resources.description: Resources can be used to override the resource definitions of the container

reversePorts.description: ReversePorts are port mappings to make local ports available inside the container

sync.description: Sync allows you to sync certain local paths with paths inside the container

persistPaths.description: PersistPaths allows you to persist certain paths within this container with a persistent volume claim

terminal.description: Terminal allows you to tell DevSpace to open a terminal with screen support to this container

logs.description: Logs allows you to tell DevSpace to stream logs from this container to the console

attach.description: Attach allows you to tell DevSpace to attach to this container

ssh.description: SSH allows you to create an SSH tunnel to this container

proxyCommands.description: ProxyCommands allow you to proxy certain local commands to the container

restartHelper.description:
RestartHelper holds restart helper specific configuration. The restart helper is used to delay starting of
the container and restarting it and is injected via an annotation in the replaced pod.

DevContainer.description: DevContainer holds options for dev services that should get started within a certain container of the selected pod

name.description: Name of the dev configuration

namespace.description: Namespace where to select the pod

container.description: Container is the container name these services should get started.

arch.description:
Target Container architecture to use for the devspacehelper (currently amd64 or arm64). Defaults to amd64, but
devspace tries to find out the architecture by itself by looking at the node this container runs on.

devImage.description:
DevImage is the image to use for this container and will replace the existing image
if necessary.

command.description: Command can be used to override the entrypoint of the container

args.description: Args can be used to override the args of the container

workingDir.description: WorkingDir can be used to override the working dir of the container

env.description:
Env can be used to add environment variables to the container. DevSpace will
not replace existing environment variables if an environment variable is defined here.

resources.description: Resources can be used to override the resource definitions of the container

reversePorts.description: ReversePorts are port mappings to make local ports available inside the container

sync.description: Sync allows you to sync certain local paths with paths inside the container

persistPaths.description: PersistPaths allows you to persist certain paths within this container with a persistent volume claim

terminal.description: Terminal allows you to tell DevSpace to open a terminal with screen support to this container

logs.description: Logs allows you to tell DevSpace to stream logs from this container to the console

attach.description: Attach allows you to tell DevSpace to attach to this container

ssh.description: SSH allows you to create an SSH tunnel to this container

proxyCommands.description: ProxyCommands allow you to proxy certain local commands to the container

restartHelper.description:
RestartHelper holds restart helper specific configuration. The restart helper is used to delay starting of
the container and restarting it and is injected via an annotation in the replaced pod.

ports.description:
Ports defines port mappings from the remote pod that should be forwarded to your local
computer

persistenceOptions.description: PersistenceOptions are additional options for persisting paths within this pod

patches.description: Patches are additional changes to the pod spec that should be applied

open.description: Open defines urls that should be opened as soon as they are reachable

DevPod.description: DevPod holds configurations for selecting a pod and starting dev services for that pod

disableFallback.description: DisableFallback allows you to turn off kaniko building if docker isn't installed

preferMinikube.description:
PreferMinikube allows you to turn off using the minikube docker daemon if the minikube
context is used.

useCli.description: UseCLI specifies if DevSpace should use the docker cli for building

args.description: Args are additional arguments to pass to the docker cli

DockerConfig.description: DockerConfig tells the DevSpace CLI to build with Docker on Minikube or on localhost

name.description: Name of the environment variable

chart.description: Chart holds the chart configuration and where DevSpace can find the chart

values.description: Values are additional values that should get passed to deploying this chart

valuesFiles.description: ValuesFiles are additional files that hold values for deploying this chart

displayOutput.description: DisplayOutput allows you to display the helm output to the console

upgradeArgs.description: UpgradeArgs are additional arguments to pass to `helm upgrade`

templateArgs.description: TemplateArgs are additional arguments to pass to `helm template`

disableDependencyUpdate.description: DisableDependencyUpdate disables helm dependencies update, default to false

HelmConfig.description: HelmConfig defines the specific helm options used during deployment

name.description: Name of the image, will be filled automatically

image.description:
Image is the complete image name including registry and repository
for example myregistry.com/mynamespace/myimage

tags.description:
Tags is an array that specifies all tags that should be build during
the build process. If this is empty, devspace will generate a random tag

dockerfile.description: Dockerfile specifies a path (relative or absolute) to the dockerfile. Defaults to ./Dockerfile.

context.description: Context is the context path to build with. Defaults to the current working directory

entrypoint.description:
Entrypoint specifies an entrypoint that will be appended to the dockerfile during
image build in memory. Example: ["sleep", "99999"]

cmd.description:
Cmd specifies the arguments for the entrypoint that will be appended
during build in memory to the dockerfile

appendDockerfileInstructions.description:
AppendDockerfileInstructions are instructions that will be appended to the Dockerfile that is build
at the current build target and are appended before the entrypoint and cmd instructions

buildArgs.description: BuildArgs are the build args that are to the build

target.description: Target is the target that should get used during the build. Only works if the dockerfile supports this

network.description: Network is the network that should get used to build the image

rebuildStrategy.description:
RebuildStrategy is used to determine when DevSpace should rebuild an image. By default, devspace will
rebuild an image if one of the following conditions is true:
- The dockerfile has changed
- The configuration within the devspace.yaml for the image has changed
- A file within the docker context (excluding .dockerignore rules) has changed
This option is ignored for custom builds.

skipPush.description:
SkipPush will not push the image to a registry if enabled. Only works if docker or buildkit is chosen
as build method

createPullSecret.description:
CreatePullSecret specifies if a pull secret should be created for this image in the
target namespace. Defaults to true

buildKit.description: BuildKit if buildKit is specified, DevSpace will build the image either in-cluster or locally with BuildKit

docker.description: Docker if docker is specified, DevSpace will build the image using the local docker daemon

kaniko.description: Kaniko if kaniko is specified, DevSpace will build the image in-cluster with kaniko

custom.description:
Custom if custom is specified, DevSpace will build the image with the help of
a custom script.

enabled.description: Enabled specifies if the given import should be enabled

path.description:
Path is the local path where DevSpace can find the artifact.
This option is mutually exclusive with the git option.

git.description:
Git is the remote repository to download the artifact from. You can either use
https projects or ssh projects here, but need to make sure git can pull the project.
This option is mutually exclusive with the path option.

subPath.description: SubPath is a path within the git repository where the artifact lies in

branch.description: Branch is the git branch to pull

tag.description: Tag is the tag to pull

revision.description: Revision is the git revision to pull

cloneArgs.description: CloneArgs are additional arguments that should be supplied to the git CLI

disableShallow.description:
DisableShallow can be used to turn off shallow clones as these are the default used
by devspace

disablePull.description: DisablePull will disable pulling every time DevSpace is reevaluating this source

Import.description: Import specifies the source of the devspace config to merge

secret.description: The secret that should be mounted

configMap.description: The configMap that should be mounted

readOnly.description:
Mounted read-only if true, read-write otherwise (false or unspecified).
Defaults to false.
+optional

mountPath.description:
Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted.  Must
not contain ':'.

subPath.description:
Path within the volume from which the container's volume should be mounted.
Defaults to "" (volume's root).
+optional

KanikoAdditionalMount.description: KanikoAdditionalMount tells devspace how the additional mount of the kaniko pod should look like

name.description:
Name of the configmap
+optional

items.description:
If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced
ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the
key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be
projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be
present. If a key is specified which is not present in the ConfigMap,
the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be
relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.
+optional

defaultMode.description:
Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a
value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644.
Directories within the path are not affected by this setting.
This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file
mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.
+optional

path.description:
The relative path of the file to map the key to.
May not be an absolute path.
May not contain the path element '..'.
May not start with the string '..'.

mode.description:
Optional: mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 0
and 0777. If not specified, the volume defaultMode will be used.
This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file
mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.
+optional

name.description:
Name of the secret in the pod's namespace to use.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#secret
+optional

items.description:
If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced
Secret will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the
key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be
projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be
present. If a key is specified which is not present in the Secret,
the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be
relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.
+optional

defaultMode.description:
Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a
value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644.
Directories within the path are not affected by this setting.
This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file
mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.
+optional

cache.description: Cache tells DevSpace if a cache repository should be used. defaults to false

snapshotMode.description: SnapshotMode tells DevSpace which snapshot mode kaniko should use. defaults to time

image.description: Image is the image name of the kaniko pod to use

initImage.description: InitImage to override the init image of the kaniko pod

args.description: Args for additional arguments that should be passed to kaniko

command.description: Command to replace the starting command for the kaniko container

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace where the kaniko pod should be run

insecure.description: Insecure allows pushing to insecure registries

pullSecret.description: PullSecret is the pull secret to mount by default

skipPullSecretMount.description: SkipPullSecretMount will skip mounting the pull secret

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is the node selector to use for the kaniko pod

tolerations.description: Tolerations is a tolerations list to use for the kaniko pod

serviceAccount.description: ServiceAccount the service account to use for the kaniko pod

generateName.description: GenerateName is the optional prefix that will be set to the generateName field of the build pod

annotations.description: Annotations are extra annotations that will be added to the build pod

labels.description: Labels are extra labels that will be added to the build pod

initEnv.description: InitEnv are extra environment variables that will be added to the build init container

env.description:
Env are extra environment variables that will be added to the build kaniko container
Will populate the env.value field.

envFrom.description:
EnvFrom are extra environment variables from configmap or secret that will be added to the build kaniko container
Will populate the env.valueFrom field.

additionalMounts.description: AdditionalMounts are additional mounts that will be added to the build pod

resources.description: Resources are the resources that should be set on the kaniko pod

KanikoConfig.description: KanikoConfig tells the DevSpace CLI to build with Docker on Minikube or on localhost

manifests.description:
Manifests is a list of files or folders that will be deployed by DevSpace using kubectl
or kustomize

applyArgs.description: ApplyArgs are extra arguments for `kubectl apply`

createArgs.description: CreateArgs are extra arguments for `kubectl create` which will be run before `kubectl apply`

kubectlBinaryPath.description: KubectlBinaryPath is the optional path where to find the kubectl binary

inlineManifest.description: InlineManifests is a block containing the manifest to deploy

kustomize.description: Kustomize can be used to enable kustomize instead of kubectl

kustomizeArgs.description: KustomizeArgs are extra arguments for `kustomize build` which will be run before `kubectl apply`

kustomizeBinaryPath.description: KustomizeBinaryPath is the optional path where to find the kustomize binary

patches.description: Patches are additional changes to the pod spec that should be applied

KubectlConfig.description: KubectlConfig defines the specific kubectl options used during deployment

enabled.description:
Enabled enables the local registry for pushing images.
When unset the local registry will be used as a fallback if there are no push permissions for the registry.
When `true` the local registry will always be used.
When `false` the local registry will never be used.

localbuild.description: LocalBuild enables use of local docker builder instead of building in the cluster

namespace.description: Namespace where the local registry is deployed. Default is the current context's namespace

name.description: Name of the deployment and service of the local registry. Default is `registry`

image.description: Image of the local registry. Default is `registry:2.8.1`

buildKitImage.description: BuildKitImage of the buildkit sidecar. Default is `moby/buildkit:master-rootless`

port.description: Port that the registry image listens on. Default is `5000`

persistence.description: Persistence settings for the local registry

LocalRegistryConfig.description: LocalRegistryConfig holds the configuration of the local image registry

enabled.description: Enable enables persistence for the local registry

size.description: Size of the persistent volume for local docker registry storage. Default is `5Gi`

storageClassName.description: StorageClassName of the persistent volume. Default is your cluster's configured default storage class

LocalRegistryPersistence.description: LocalRegistryPersistence configures persistence settings for the local registry

enabled.description: Enabled can be used to enable printing container logs

lastLines.description: LastLines is the amount of lines to print of the running container initially

url.description: URL is the url to open in the browser after it is available

OpenConfig.description: OpenConfig defines what to open after services have been started

op.description: Operation is the path operation to do. Can be either replace, add or remove

path.description: Path is the config path to apply the patch to

value.description: Value is the value to use for this patch.

PatchConfig.description: PatchConfig describes a config patch and how it should be applied

target.description: Target describes where to apply a config patch

op.description: Operation is the path operation to do. Can be either replace, add or remove

path.description: Path is the config path to apply the patch to

value.description: Value is the value to use for this patch.

PatchTarget.description: PatchTarget describes a config patch and how it should be applied

size.description: Size is the size of the created persistent volume in Kubernetes size notation like 5Gi

storageClassName.description: StorageClassName is the storage type DevSpace should use for this persistent volume

accessModes.description: AccessModes are the access modes DevSpace should use for the persistent volume

readOnly.description: ReadOnly specifies if the volume should be read only

name.description:
Name is the name of the PVC that should be created. If a PVC with that name
already exists, DevSpace will use that PVC instead of creating one.

PersistenceOptions.description: PersistenceOptions are general persistence options DevSpace should use for all persistent paths within a single dev configuration

path.description:
Path is the container path that should get persisted. By default, DevSpace will create an init container
that will copy over the contents of this folder from the existing image.

volumePath.description: VolumePath is the sub path on the volume that is mounted as persistent volume for this path

readOnly.description: ReadOnly will make the persistent path read only to the user

skipPopulate.description: SkipPopulate will not create an init container to copy over the existing contents if true

initContainer.description: InitContainer holds additional options for the persistent path init container

PersistentPath.description: PersistentPath holds options to configure persistence for DevSpace

resources.description: Resources are the resources used by the persistent path init container

PersistentPathInitContainer.description: PersistentPathInitContainer defines additional options for the persistent path init container

name.description: Name of the pipeline, will be filled automatically

run.description: Run is the actual shell command that should be executed during this pipeline

flags.description:
Flags are extra flags that can be used for running the pipeline via
devspace run-pipeline.

continueOnError.description:
ContinueOnError will not fail the whole job and pipeline if
a call within the step fails.

Pipeline.description: Pipeline defines what DevSpace should do.

name.description: Name is the name of the flag

short.description: Short is optional and is the shorthand name for this flag. E.g. 'g' converts to '-g'

type.description: Type is the type of the flag. Defaults to `bool`

default.description: Default is the default value for this flag

description.description: Description is the description as shown in `devspace run-pipeline my-pipe -h`

PipelineFlag.description: PipelineFlag defines an extra pipeline flag

requests.description: Requests are the requests part of the resources

limits.description: Limits are the limits part of the resources

PodResources.description: PodResources describes the resources section of the started kaniko pod

port.description:
Port is a port mapping that maps the localPort:remotePort. So if
you port forward the remote port will be available at the local port.
If you do reverse port forwarding, the local port will be available
at the remote port in the container. If only port is specified, local and
remote port are the same.

bindAddress.description:
BindAddress is the address DevSpace should listen on. Optional and defaults
to localhost.

PortMapping.description: PortMapping defines the ports for a PortMapping

gitCredentials.description: GitCredentials configures a git credentials helper inside the container that proxies local git credentials

command.description:
Command is the name of the command that should be available in the remote container. DevSpace
will create a small script for that inside the container that redirect command execution to
the local computer.

localCommand.description:
LocalCommand can be used to run a different command than specified via the command option. By
default, this will be assumed to be the same as command.

skipContainerEnv.description: SkipContainerEnv will not forward the container environment variables to the local command

env.description: Env are extra environment variables to set for the command

name.description: Name is the pull secret name to deploy

registry.description:
The registry to create the image pull secret for.
Empty string == docker hub
e.g. gcr.io

username.description:
The username of the registry. If this is empty, devspace will try
to receive the auth data from the local docker

password.description:
The password to use for the registry. If this is empty, devspace will
try to receive the auth data from the local docker

serviceAccounts.description: The service account to add the secret to

PullSecretConfig.description: PullSecretConfig defines a pull secret that should be created by DevSpace

name.description: Name is the name of the command that should be installed

versionArgs.description: VersionArgs are the arguments to retrieve the version of the command

versionRegEx.description: VersionRegEx is the regex that is used to parse the version

version.description: Version constraint of the command that should be installed

devspace.description: DevSpace specifies the DevSpace version constraint that is needed to use this config

commands.description: Commands specifies an array of commands that need to be installed locally to use this config

plugins.description: Plugins specifies an array of plugins that need to be installed locally

name.description: Name of the plugin that should be installed

version.description: Version constraint of the plugin that should be installed

path.description:
Path defines the path to the restart helper that might be used if certain config
options are enabled

inject.description: Inject signals DevSpace to inject the restart helper

enabled.description:
Enabled can be used to enable the ssh server within the container. By default,
DevSpace will generate the required keys and create an entry in your ~/.ssh/config
for this container that can be used via `ssh dev-config-name.dev-project-name.devspace`

localHostname.description: LocalHostname is the local ssh host to write to the ~/.ssh/config

localPort.description: LocalPort is the local port to forward from, if empty will be random

remoteAddress.description: RemoteAddress is the address to listen to inside the container

useInclude.description:
UseInclude tells DevSpace to use a the file ~/.ssh/devspace_config for its ssh entries. DevSpace
will also create an import for its own entries inside ~/.ssh/config, this is a cleaner way,
but unfortunately not all SSH clients support this.

path.description:
Path is the path to sync. This can be defined in the form localPath:remotePath. You can also use '.'
to specify either the local or remote working directory. This is valid for example: .:.

excludePaths.description: ExcludePaths is an array of file patterns in gitignore format to exclude.

excludeFile.description: ExcludeFile loads the file patterns to exclude from a file.

downloadExcludePaths.description: DownloadExcludePaths is an array of file patterns in gitignore format to exclude from downloading

downloadExcludeFile.description: DownloadExcludeFile loads the file patterns to exclude from downloading from a file.

uploadExcludePaths.description: UploadExcludePaths is an array of file patterns in gitignore format to exclude from uploading

uploadExcludeFile.description: UploadExcludeFile loads the file patterns to exclude from uploading from a file.

startContainer.description:
StartContainer will start the container after initial sync is done. This will
inject a devspacehelper into the pod and you need to define dev.*.command for
this to work.

onUpload.description:
OnUpload can be used to execute certain commands on uploading either in the container or locally as
well as restart the container after a file changed has happened.

initialSync.description: InitialSync defines the initial sync strategy to use when this sync starts. Defaults to mirrorLocal

waitInitialSync.description: WaitInitialSync can be used to tell DevSpace to not wait until the initial sync is done

initialSyncCompareBy.description: InitialSyncCompareBy defines if the sync should only compare by the given type. Either mtime or size are possible

bandwidthLimits.description:
BandwidthLimits can be used to limit the amount of bytes that are transferred by DevSpace with this
sync configuration

polling.description: Polling will tell the remote container to use polling instead of inotify

noWatch.description: NoWatch will terminate the sync after the initial sync is done

file.description: File signals DevSpace that this is a single file that should get synced instead of a whole directory

SyncConfig.description: SyncConfig defines the paths for a SyncFolder

name.description: Name is the name to show for this exec in the logs

command.description:
Command is the command to execute. If no args are specified this is executed
within a shell.

args.description: Args are arguments to pass to the command

failOnError.description: FailOnError specifies if the sync should fail if the command fails

local.description:
Local specifies if the command should be executed locally instead of within the
container

once.description:
Once executes this command only once in the container's life. Can be used to initialize
a container before starting it, but after everything was synced.

onChange.description: OnChange is an array of file patterns that trigger this command execution

restartContainer.description:
If true restart container will try to restart the container after a change has been made. Make sure that
images.*.injectRestartHelper is enabled for the container that should be restarted or the devspace-restart-helper
script is present in the container root folder.

exec.description: Exec will execute the given commands in order after a sync operation

SyncOnUpload.description: SyncOnUpload defines the struct for the command that should be executed when files / folders are uploaded

path.description:
Path is the (relative) path of the tanka environment, usually identified by jsonnetfile.json.
It can be omitted if environmentPath is set and is also relative to the working directory (Tanka's project directory tree). If omitted, Devspace will traverse in reverse environmentPath looking for jsonnetfile.json, when found, that will be set as Path. Otherwise will throw an error.

runJsonnetBundlerInstall.description: RunJsonnetBundlerInstall indicates if the `jb install` command shall be run, default to true

runJsonnetBundlerUpdate.description: RunJsonnetBundlerUpdate indicates if the `jb update` command shall be run default to false

environmentPath.description:
EnvironmentPath is the (relative) path to a specific tanka environment.
In case Path is omitted it will be used to discover Tanka project's root. Look at Path parameter for more details.

environmentName.description: When using environment auto-discovery, this maps to the `--name` parameter

targets.description: Maps to the option `--target` argument and allows filtering for specific resources.

jsonnetBundlerBinaryPath.description: JsonBundlerBinaryPath allows overriding the `jb` binary used.

tankaBinaryPath.description: JsonBundlerBinaryPath allows overriding the `tanka` binary used.

TankaConfig.description: TankaConfig defines the specific tanka options used during deployment.

apiVersion.description: ApiVersion is the Kubernetes api of the target resource

kind.description: Kind is the kind of the target resource (eg: Deployment, Service ...)

name.description: Name is the name of the target resource

Target.description: Target describes where to apply a config patch

command.description:
Command is the command that should be executed on terminal start.
This command is executed within a shell.

workDir.description: WorkDir is the working directory that is used to execute the command in.

enabled.description:
If enabled is true, DevSpace will use the terminal. Can be also
used to disable the terminal if set to false. DevSpace makes sure
that within a pipeline only one dev configuration can open a terminal
at a time and subsequent dev terminals will fail.

disableReplace.description:
DisableReplace tells DevSpace to not replace the pod or adjust its settings
to make sure the pod is sleeping when opening a terminal

disableScreen.description:
DisableScreen will disable screen which is used by DevSpace by default to preserve
sessions if connections interrupt or the session is lost.

disableTTY.description: DisableTTY will disable a tty shell for terminal command execution

name.description: Name is the name of the variable

value.description: Value is a shortcut for using source: none and default: my-value

question.description: Question can be used to define a custom question if the variable was not yet used

default.description: Default is the default value the variable should have if not set by the user

options.description: Options are options that can be selected when the variable question is asked

password.description: Password signals that this variable should not be visible if entered

validationPattern.description: ValidationPattern can be used to verify the user input

validationMessage.description: ValidationMessage can be used to tell the user the format of the variable value

noCache.description: NoCache can be used to prompt the user on every run for this variable

command.description:
Command is the command how to retrieve the variable. If args is omitted, command is parsed as a shell
command.

args.description: Args are optional args that will be used for the command

commands.description:
Commands are additional commands that can be used to run a different command on a different operating
system.

alwaysResolve.description: AlwaysResolve makes sure this variable will always be resolved and not only if it is used somewhere. Defaults to false.

source.description: Source defines where the variable should be taken from

os.description:
OperatingSystem is optional and defines the operating system this
command should be executed on

command.description:
Command is the command to use to retrieve the value for this variable. If no
args are specified the command is run within a pseudo shell.

args.description: Args are optional arguments for the command

version.description:
Version holds the config version. DevSpace will always convert older configs to the current latest
config version, which makes it possible to use the newest DevSpace version also with older config
versions.

name.description:
Name specifies the name of the DevSpace project and uniquely identifies a project.
DevSpace will not allow multiple active projects with the same name in the same Kubernetes namespace.

imports.description:
Imports merges specified config files into this one. This is very useful to split up your DevSpace configuration
into multiple files and reuse those through git, a remote url or common local path.

functions.description:
Functions are POSIX functions that can be used within pipelines. Those functions can also be imported by
imports.

pipelines.description:
Pipelines are the work blocks that DevSpace should execute when devspace dev, devspace build, devspace deploy or devspace purge
is called. Pipelines are defined through a special POSIX script that allows you to use special commands
such as create_deployments, start_dev, build_images etc. to signal DevSpace you want to execute
a specific functionality. The pipelines dev, build, deploy and purge are special and will override
the default functionality of the respective command if defined. All other pipelines can be either run
via the devspace run-pipeline command or used within another pipeline through run_pipelines.

images.description:
Images holds configuration of how DevSpace should build images. By default, DevSpace will build all defined images.
If you are using a custom pipeline, you can dynamically define which image is built at which time during the
execution.

deployments.description:
Deployments holds configuration of how DevSpace should deploy resources to Kubernetes. By default, DevSpace will deploy all defined deployments.
If you are using a custom pipeline, you can dynamically define which deployment is deployed at which time during the
execution.

dev.description:
Dev holds development configuration. Each dev configuration targets a single pod and enables certain dev services on that pod
or even rewrites it if certain changes are requested, such as adding an environment variable or changing the entrypoint.
Dev allows you to:
- sync local folders to the Kubernetes pod
- port forward remote ports to your local computer
- forward local ports into the Kubernetes pod
- configure an ssh tunnel to the Kubernetes pod
- proxy local commands to the container
- restart the container on file changes

vars.description: Vars are config variables that can be used inside other config sections to replace certain values dynamically

commands.description:
Commands are custom commands that can be executed via 'devspace run COMMAND'. These commands are run within a pseudo bash
that also allows executing special commands such as run_watch or is_equal.

dependencies.description:
Dependencies are sub devspace projects that lie in a local folder or remote git repository that can be executed
from within the pipeline. In contrast to imports, these projects pose as separate fully functional DevSpace projects
that typically lie including source code in a different folder and can be used to compose a full microservice
application that will be deployed by DevSpace. Each dependency name can only be used once and if you want to use
the same project multiple times, make sure to use a different name for each of those instances.

pullSecrets.description:
PullSecrets are image pull secrets that will be created by devspace in the target namespace
during devspace dev or devspace deploy. DevSpace will merge all defined pull secrets into a single
one or the one specified.

require.description:
Require defines what DevSpace, plugins and command versions are required to use this config and if a condition is not
fulfilled, DevSpace will fail.

localRegistry.description: LocalRegistry specifies the configuration for a local image registry
